pageContext.claim: “You heard this story last night about Air Force One. We saved a lot of money. I said to Boeing, 'No, it's got to have a three in front of it.' They were going to buy Air Force 1. 5.7 billion, 5.7 billion, it's a lot of money, but it's -- Look, it's a hell of a deal, it's a hell of a plane. What can I tell you? I said, 'How much is the new plane?' It was signed by Obama. '5.7 billion, sir.' I said that's a lot of money. It's actually two planes. You know Air Force One, it's two planes. I give you a little detail, they'd say that's classified information. Well, they've been flying around with two planes for 30 years.....I get a call from Boeing with 3.9 billion -- B, OK, I said yes, it's got three already. True. True story. True story.”
pageContext.analysis: False. Trump often tells a long story about how he squeezed Boeing for more than $1 billion in savings during his first weeks in office. The cost of the new Air Force One jets has actually gone up by more than $1 billion, according to the Pentagon's first formal acquisition report for the aircraft.
